turns.speaker: DR. PAYSON
turns.text: Mr. X is a demagogue. He has no place to go, so he exaggerates. He's a disservice to every good law-abiding Negro in the country. Can I ask you a question?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Please, go ahead.

turns.speaker: DR. PAYSON
turns.text: Mr. Malcolm X, why do you teach black supremacy? Why do you teach hate?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: For the white man to ask the black man if he hates him is just like the rapist asking the raped, or the wolf asking the sheep, "Do you hate me!" The white man is in no moral position to accuse anyone of hate.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Stop me if I'm wrong. I "polarize the community." I "erroneously appraise the racial picture."

turns.speaker: DR. PAYSON
turns.text: You put it very well.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You left one phrase out. Another educated Kneegrew said to me and I quote: "Brother Malcolm oversimplifies the dynamic interstices of the Negro subculture." Would you agree?

turns.speaker: DR. PAYSON
turns.text: Entirely.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Well, I have this to say. Do you know what a Negro with a B.A., an M.A. and a Ph.D. is called -- by the white man? I'll tell you. He's called a nigger.

turns.speaker: DR. PAYSON
turns.text: Let him finish.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Thank you. Now the Negro in the field caught hell all day long. He was beaten by the master; he lived in a shack, wore castoff clothes and hated his master. If the house caught fire, he'd pray for a wind. If the master got sick, he'd pray that he'd die. And if you said to him, "Let's go, let's separate", he'd yell, "Yeah, man, any place is better than this." You've got a lot of Field Negroes in America today. I'm one.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: If you want to tell me.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: Women are deceitful. They are untrustworthy flesh. I've seen too many men ruined or tied down or messed up by women.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: If I surprise you, let me explain. Menial work teaches us humility.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Let me do it then.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: No, each of us must relearn that work is the only worthwhile thing. Allah has given you a great gift. Use it wisely, never forgetting that we are nothing, while He is all.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Allah Akbar.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: Did you see the papers today?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Yes, sir, I did.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: That was a very bad statement. The country loved this man, and you have made it hard in general for Muslims.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: Can I ask you something?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Sure, man.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: Are you Elijah's pimp?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: "His greatest greatness."

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Say what you're saying.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: If you don't know, man, then I feel sorriest for you.

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: I thought you said we were going to the movies last night.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I say a lot of things.

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: And like a fool I believe it.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Do your job, Get me a bourbon on the rocks and a pack of Lucky's.

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: You know that gal?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Mind your own goddamn business... She comes in a lot?

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: 'Bout every other night, Red.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: With him?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: She know?

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: If she got eyes, she do.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Is she hooking?

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: Not yet. But the way things going, that boy gonna turn her out any day.

turns.speaker: VOICE OF MALCOLM X
turns.text: The average first offender gets two years for burglary. We were all first offenders. That's what Sophia and Peg drew --

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Two years in the Women's Reformatory at Framingham.

turns.speaker: VOICE OF MALCOLM X
turns.text: But our crime wasn't burglary. It was balling white girls. They gave us the book.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Burglary, count one -- 8 to 10 years; count two, 8 to 10 years; count three, 8 to 10 years...

turns.speaker: VOICE OF MALCOLM X
turns.text: Fourteen counts of 8 to 10 years.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: The sentences to run concurrently.

turns.speaker: VOICE OF MALCOLM X
turns.text: Shorty thought he hit us with 114 years till I explained what concurrently meant. It meant a minimum sentence of 10 years hard labor at the Charlestown State Prison. The date was February 1946. I wasn't quite 21. I had not yet begun to shave.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: 'Lo. I've got to freshen up.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Now you come back.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I better not come in.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I ain't stupid.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I mean it's late, baby.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I know where you're going.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I'm going to bed. I gotta work tomorrow, need my rest.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Baby, I'll call you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: What for? I ain't white and I don't put out.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Malcolm, you can be anything you want. You got class and you're smart.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: All them books you read and you still don't know nuthin.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I do know I love you.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Why? Is it because of your white gal? Folks say you're running around town with her.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Save it, baby. Save it for Mr. Right, 'cause your grandma's smarter than ya think.

turns.speaker: MISS DUNNE
turns.text: It's the same questions, Mrs. Little. Since the death of your husband --

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Murder.

turns.speaker: MISS DUNNE
turns.text: -- there is a serious question as to whether --

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: These are my children. Mine. And they ain't no question. None.

turns.speaker: MISS DUNNE
turns.text: I think sometimes, Mrs. Little, candor is the only kindness.

turns.speaker: MISS DUNNE
turns.text: All of your children are delinquent, Mrs. Little, and one, at least, Malcolm is a thief.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Get out.

turns.speaker: MISS DUNNE
turns.text: Your control over your children, therefore --

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Did you hear me?!

turns.speaker: MISS DUNNE
turns.text: You'll regret this, Mrs. Little.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: If you don't move out through that door, you're going to be past all regretting.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: How many you turning out?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Make it 1000. We got a lot of fishing to do.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Brother Malcolm, I want you to meet Brother Earl. He just joined the Nation.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Thank you, Brother; Sister, how are you?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Please make way, please --

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Another one?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: How long has this been going on?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: All day since you and Betty left. Brother Minister, I have to level with you. They gave me a mission. But I couldn't do it. I love y'all.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What mission?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: To wire your car so it would explode when you turned the ignition. The Ministers say you are spreading untruths about the Messenger. The Ministers say you are a great hypocrite, Judas, Benedict Arnold. The Ministers say your tongue should be cut out and delivered to the Messenger's doorstep.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What does Sidney say?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I'm with you, Brother Minister.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: No. You'll be marked for death.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Let me die then.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I won't let myself come between you and your father. Go home.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You're my father.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: And don't come back.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Sheeet, you ain't. I had aplenty.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: ...That isn't a whore?

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: That's alright. Baby, take your time. Sophia's not going anywhere. I told you to walk, don't run.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Shhhh! I don't like women that talk.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: You like 'em scrambled soft or hard, sweetie?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: C'mere.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Sweetie, they're almost ready.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You hear me, girl?

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: You the man.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You better believe it.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: You evil this morning.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What's your story, baby?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Yeah, girl; that's your story. When you gonna holler "rape," sister?

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You will, baby -- if the time come.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Lemme feed you, sweetie, while they hot.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Baby, I was gonna give it to you.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Well, bitch you move too slow.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: You had the number.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Baby, I got to let this old man win. Keep the faith, and tell Billie I'll see her later.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Well, all right, then.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Well, all reet, then.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Hey, man, gimme some skin.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Shorty, this is Laura.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: That's a fine chick.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Fine as May wine.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Except she live on the hill and got a grandma.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Make it too easy and it ain't no fun.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Don't you know, you can't hump the Bogart.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Eat lead, coppers.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Bang, bang. You're dead.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Naw, you missed me, copper. Try this on for size.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: I forgot to tell you I'm wearing a bulletproof vest.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: The hell you are.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: I'm tired of always playing the cops. I wanna be Bogart sometimes.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You're too small to be Bogart.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: I'm not too short to be Cagney.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Yeah and get a slave, too, huh, baby?

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: I ain't doing bad.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Man, the name musicians ain't got shit. How you gonna have something? I need a stake, a bundle, a grand. My woman can't afford it; my homey ain't got it. How about you baby? What you got?

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Jesus, Red, she's just a kid.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Jesus ain't got nothin' to do with this.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: That ain't bad.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Tell him about Baldy.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Don't never try to cross someone who ain't afraid to die.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: You the man!

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: What did you do, Homey, palm it?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Palmed it right in the goddam chamber.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Homey, you are nuts.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: I got to hand it to you, Homey. That's the best preacher hype I ever did hear.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: It isn't a hype, Shorty. And I meant what I said: join us.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Come on, baby. I don't pay that shit no mind.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: The Honorable Elijah Muhammad says you should pay it all your mind. If you got a mind.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Baby, I love you. Take it easy, greasy. How about a snort?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I've been clean for twelve years, Shorty.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: You is something, Homeboy. My trouble is -- I ain't had enough stuff yet, I ain't et all the ribs I want and I sure ain't had enough white tail yet.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: How's the rest of the gang? You seen anyone?

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Well, Sammy's dead. Yeah, fell over in the bed with a chick twenty years younger than him. Had twenty-five grand in his pocket.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I'm half wop, half nigger and ain't afraid of no one.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What can you do?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Then I put him to bed and pour talcum powder on him like a baby. He gets his jollies off.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: So what about him?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: So? The man got silver, china, rugs --

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Might be all right.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Might be, shit. Man, I know this town. I got my own fences. Who the hell are you? Who put you in charge?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You want to be the head man?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Head nigger in charge?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I'm the man.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Okay, baby. Let's flip for it. Flip this.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Your turn, Rudy. You want me to flip for you?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Jesus Christ, no. Okay, okay. You got it, you got it! You're the boss.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I'm Minister Malcolm X. Two witnesses saw him brought in. He was not brought out.

turns.speaker: PLAINCLOTHES
turns.text: You heard the Sergeant. Outside.

turns.speaker: PLAINCLOTHES
turns.text: Who the hell are they?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Brothers of Brother Johnson.

turns.speaker: PLAINCLOTHES
turns.text: Eddie, let's see that blotter.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Only a pig could do a thing like that.

turns.speaker: PLAINCLOTHES
turns.text: Watch your tongue, boy.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Don't you call me boy, you pig. Letting a man bleed like that.

turns.speaker: SISTER LUCILLE
turns.text: Brother Minister he often talked about you. He loves you, loves you like his own son. Says you are the best, his greatest Minister but that someday you would leave him and turn against him.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: He told you that?

turns.speaker: SISTER LUCILLE
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: SISTER LUCILLE
turns.text: Yes, I am, Brother Minister. All I want is support for my children. He should provide for his children. That's all I want.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Allah will provide.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM'S VOICE
turns.text: We were parceled out, all five of us. I went to this reform school and lived at this woman's house. She was in charge.

turns.speaker: MRS. SWERLIN
turns.text: This is your room, Malcolm. I know you'll keep it clean.

turns.speaker: MRS. SWERLIN
turns.text: This is Malcolm, our new guest. We'll treat him like a brother.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM'S VOICE
turns.text: I was special. The only colored kid in class. I became a sort of mascot. Like a pink poodle.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM'S VOICE
turns.text: I didn't know then that I was a nigger.

turns.speaker: MRS. SWERLIN
turns.text: He's bright.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM'S VOICE
turns.text: They talked about me like

turns.speaker: MRS. SWERLIN
turns.text: Good grades. Fine athlete. President of his class.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM'S VOICE
turns.text: I wasn't there. Like I was some kind of pedigreed dog or a horse. Like I was invisible.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: What am I doing here?

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: Believe it or not, you're safe here. The Judicial police will kill you. If they can.  This page?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: You have a rather checkered past. Mr. Creasy. Your Interpol file is six pages long.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Am I a suspect?

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: No. It would be convenient, but no.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Show me mugshots of Mexican policemen. Maybe then we'll get somewhere.

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: All these photos you just saw were of policemen. Sadly they're protected. La Hermanidad. The brotherhood.

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: Hombre en fuego. Man On Fire. That's what the papers have named you.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: It's what you and Rosanna named me. Right?

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: Sit, Creasy. Everything that happens from now on does so with my permission.  Really. You won't find a better carne asada in all of Mexico.

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: The last few days may represent the best police work of my life.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: The same thing as you. Except, my reach isn't as long as yours. My father was a policemen, did you know that?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I don't know shit about you.

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: He was one of the original founders of 'Le Hermanidad' in the days when it represented good not evil.

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: My family lives in Miami. Because of the death threats.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: It's not worth it. Be with them instead.

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: It galls me to watch you. You can do as much in days as I can in years. Men like the 'The Dreamer' are protected. Out of everyone's grasp it seems, but yours.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Are you going to arrest me or talk me to death?

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: My country needs justice. Proper justice. Gunning men down in the street only feeds the violence. They need to be brought to trial. Dealt with properly. Then people will respect the law. When they see it works.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: So you are going to talk me to death.

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: You walk out and deal justice. You're what I wish I could be.  The policemen who kills you, his family will have all they want.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Then I hope the one who gets me has got lots of kids. What do you want?

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: I want to arrest you for murder! I want to shake your hand and reload your gun! I want to kill my pride and give you my blessing.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: My deal is with Rosanna. I knew you guys were up to something. Are you two fucking?

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: No, but I have to admit I thought about it.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Liar. Just tell me who the bank card belongs to. Name and address.

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: You have no interest in making things easy, do you?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I'm not... easy.

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: Creasy...  I'd have liked to have known you under different circumstances.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Off the top of my head, I don't know what they could've been.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMS
turns.text: [Where are you coming from?]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [South America.]

turns.speaker: CUSTOMS
turns.text: [Where are you staying in Mexico?]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [I'm on to Juarez.]

turns.speaker: CUSTOMS
turns.text: [Why?]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [I have a friend there.]

turns.speaker: CUSTOMS
turns.text: [Senor?]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [It's a permit to carry a gun in Columbia. The gun you're about to find in that suitcase.]

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: A lot of people are looking for you.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I guess that makes you the smart one.

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: We're interested in the same thing. I'm writing a story.

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: It's Santa Muerte. Death worship. The religion of La Hermanidad. There's a curse on you.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: It's a little late.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Maybe I can help your situation and you mine.

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: So where do we begin?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I need the name and address of the owner of a Toyota Corolla, license number ME31704... We didn't get the last digit so I need the ten possible matches.

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: So what do I get in return?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Let's see how the relationship develops. I'll call you in the AM. Thanks.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I need something. Do you have banking connections?

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: I have connections.

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: Where do I find you?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I'll call you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: What do you know about the cop? Tazinari. The one who made the ransom drop with Samuel Ramos?

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: He's an old fashioned patrone with the worst reputation. He's high on my hit list.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Where does he live?

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: He lives in a Judicial Compound. He travels by motorcade. He has better protection than George Bush. Even more importantly he is part of La Hermanidad. His reach is far and wide.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Give me the address.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Another favor... get me banking info on Jordan Kalfus. U.S. deposits or withdrawals. Thanks. Oh, get me the same on Samuel Ramos.

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: How do I contact you? We still don't have the ATM info.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: You don't, I'll call you. Oh! I have a tape recording that I am sure will interest you.

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: I traced the PIN. I have an address for you. But I need to see you.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I show, you give me the information?

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: Deal.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Reina Rosas.]

turns.speaker: REINA
turns.text: [Si.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [How do you contact 'the Boss'?]

turns.speaker: REINA
turns.text: [We page him and he calls back on this cell phone.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [What is his name?]

turns.speaker: REINA
turns.text: [Daniel.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Daniel what?]

turns.speaker: REINA
turns.text: [Daniel Rosas Sanchez.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [So you're married to him? And this looks remarkably like his brother.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [What is his name?]

turns.speaker: REINA
turns.text: [Aurillio Rosas Sanchez.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [How does it work?]

turns.speaker: GUARDIAN TWO
turns.text: [Everything on the cellphone. We wait for calls. We have no number to call.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Who pays you?]

turns.speaker: GUARDIAN TWO
turns.text: [We have an ATM bank card. We draw out 300 dollars every two weeks.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [What's the PIN number?]

turns.speaker: GUARDIAN TWO
turns.text: [The what?]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [The number you use at the bank machine.]

turns.speaker: GUARDIAN TWO
turns.text: [Four-seven-four-seven.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Who killed her? You?]

turns.speaker: GUARDIAN TWO
turns.text: [No!]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Don't lie to me.]

turns.speaker: GUARDIAN TWO
turns.text: [The boss did or his brother.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Who's the boss?]

turns.speaker: GUARDIAN TWO
turns.text: [We don't know! We never see his face! We have to wait in the other room. He was screaming to the girl that...]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [What money?]

turns.speaker: GUARDIAN TWO
turns.text: [The ransom money. At the drop. He said Tazinari, one of the policemen had taken it. He was crazy.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Who's Tazinari?]

turns.speaker: GUARDIAN TWO
turns.text: [Head of the anti-kidnapping division.]

turns.speaker: SISTER ANNA
turns.text: [She's late, Mr. Creasy.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Yeah, I've got to get used to the routes. I -- It won't happen again.]

turns.speaker: SISTER ANNA
turns.text: [No offense, but I'm sorry that your profession needs to exist.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [So am I, Sister.]

turns.speaker: SISTER ANNA
turns.text: [Do you ever see the hand of God in what you do?]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Not for a long time, sister.]

turns.speaker: SISTER ANNA
turns.text: [The bible says, "Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good."]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Romans, chapter 12, verse 21.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Drive.]

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: [Do you know who I am?]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [You are Jorge Ramirez.]

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: [Do you know who I am?]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Who are you?]

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: [I am the President of La Hermanidad.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [The Ramos kidnapping. How did it work?]

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: [I don't know. We were just given instructions to take her.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Ordered by who?]

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: [I don't know! We work in parts. A voice calls in a kidnapping. We deliver the target to the guardians. We don't even know them. They might transfer to other guardians. The negotiators and the bosses don't even see the target. They just make the deal!]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Who ordered it?]

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: [The cops call him 'The Dreamer'.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Where do I find him?]

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: [I don't know. No one knows.]

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: [I don't know, I swear.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [I believe you.]

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: [I'm professional. I just do my job.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Me, too. Tell me about the guardians.]

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: [He called me on the cell phone to set a time and location for the switch.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Who's he?]

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: [The one who transferred Pinta to their car.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Who's he?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: I don't know, but I know his face.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: [I see him sometimes at the handball court in Chapultepec on a Saturday afternoon.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [How do I recognize him.]

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: [He has a tattoo covering two-thirds of his back. He is part of the Brotherhood.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [In the next hour, where do I find your partner?]

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: [One-one-three Arco Iris. Third floor.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Hello Daniel. I've got your family and I want to negotiate.]

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: [Mr. Creasy. What do you want?]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [I want you.]

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: [How much do you want?]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [It's non-negotiable.]

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: [Two million U.S.... Three million U.S.?]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [I told you, non-negotiable.]

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: [The most important thing in life is family. And there you are. You have my family. What do you want?]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [I want you.]

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: [This is not possible. But in that house I have money. If I tell you where --]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Your brother wants to talk to you.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Yeah.  Yes.]

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: [Listen! I will give you a life for a life.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [What do you mean?]

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: [Her life for your life.]

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: [The girl's. Pinta's.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [You're a liar. Pinta's dead.]

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: [I'm a businessman. A dead girl is worth nothing. She is alive.]

turns.speaker: TAZINARI
turns.text: [Do you know who I am? I am the commandante of the Judicial anti- kidnapping division.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [And one of the founding members of La Hermanidad.]

turns.speaker: TAZINARI
turns.text: [Correct!]

turns.speaker: TAZINARI
turns.text: [Please, don't...]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [It's all up to you, commandante. Tell me about you and 'The Dreamer'.]

turns.speaker: TAZINARI
turns.text: [I don't know him. I saw the opportunity and got lucky.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Lucky how?]

turns.speaker: TAZINARI
turns.text: [That he used policemen. That you killed them, it made it a police matter. The Ramos family couldn't refuse our involvement.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [And?]

turns.speaker: TAZINARI
turns.text: [And I had my men ready.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [You stole the drop.]

turns.speaker: TAZINARI
turns.text: [Yes. Many times.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [O.K. So tell me more.]

turns.speaker: TAZINARI
turns.text: [There was no ten million dollars.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [The ransom was ten.]

turns.speaker: TAZINARI
turns.text: [Two and a half. That's how much there was.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Don't lie to me!]

turns.speaker: TAZINARI
turns.text: [Two and a half! The rest was paper! Strips of paper!]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Maybe your men stole from you.]

turns.speaker: TAZINARI
turns.text: [No. Whoever took the rest took it before the exchange.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [Who gave the bags to Ramos?]

turns.speaker: TAZINARI
turns.text: [His lawyer. Jordan Kalfus.]

turns.speaker: TAZINARI
turns.text: [That's all I know! Please. I'm sorry for the girl. But it was business! I'm a professional.]

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: [That's what everybody keeps saying.]

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: Were you provided with a gun?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: Show me, please.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Nine millimeter. A Sig Sauer 226.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: Have you used this type before?
